feedback: not really the buses themselves but the times shown on the nextbus app not accurate sometimes
sometimes the buses come too close together or too far apart

the fact that tourists are allowed to squeeze in before students take their bus is unfair for me. this day was fine, but a few times i missed my bus to classes because they took up space with their luggage and items. aside from that, still relatively good.
the bus rides are quite choppy and it is very hard to maintain my balance
how many seats there are on the bus
the bus frequencies and how the driver drives
having a good air ventilation / strong aircon in the bus when its very crowded
how packed the buses are, whether the nus bus app is accurate or not, whether the bus driver is friendly or not, other passengers' behaviour/actions on the bus (eg. whether they move in)
whether i can get on the bus
whether i can hold on to any grab poles or hand grips when the bus is moving
if there are increased intervals of the buses, i would be more satisfied
the next bus app timings has inaccurate timings. i once waited 45mins for a bus that was supposed to arrive in 1min
perhaps the attitude of the bus driver

comfort and safety also depends on whether i am able to get a seat on the bus. if i have to stand, being near the windows and having something to lean on makes me feel more comfortable and safe than standing towards the centre of the bus and struggling to hold onto the supports.
the way that the driver drives, there are instant acceleration sometimes which i can’t maintain my balance
if the bus timing on the app is accurate

main_reason_for_taking_isb: To go to in-school accommodation (halls, RCs, houses etc.)
To go to in-school accommodation (halls, RCs, houses etc.)

feedback: like how public buses require passengers to tap a card, our buses could have a feature where it detects a student card
traffic conditions, driver's speed and jam brake, weather conditions, mood and friendliness of the driver, accurate prediction timings
if i get to sit down would be nice
driver drive too fast, almost falling

missing at least 1 to 2 buses because of the crowd on the bus (i cannot fit), cannot hold onto anything on the bus, the number of things i have to carry on that day (e.g. if i have to bring cca logistics to school, then i won't take isb because paiseh)
how roughly the driver drives eg if they speed over a speed bump or turn extra hard and the passengers are tossed around
the driver's mood on that day
the shakiness of the bus, when it’s very crowded there’s limited poles to hold onto. it cause me to stumble sometimes

old/new bus - old buses tend to have narrow walkways and less seating (long waiting time before boarding as many are slowly alighting, very difficult to alight when the bus is full), the suspension is also much worse - less safe
not really satisfied but i don't see a point in the wireless charging system the new nus buses have cos the rides are too short for it to have a significance impact.
whether i have enough standing space to be close enough to any grab bar, ease of leaving the bus, number of buses i have to wait for until i manage to get on one
how rough the bus driver drives
when i reach the bus stop and the bus just arrives.
sometimes bus damn shaky or the uncle drive very fast
